title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 11 February 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)
kōrero waenga: Mihi kau ana ki a koe, ki a rātou mā o te motu e rongo ake anō ki te kōrero. Mihi atu anō ki a koe, tēnā koe, tēnā koutou.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 12 February 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon JOHN TAMIHERE (Minister of Youth Affairs)
kōrero waenga: I want to pause and pay a special mihi to one of the security officers who died tragically in an accident just before Parliament resumed. E tū te ārai kua whetūrangitia. Tēnei te mihi atu e te rangatira Sam. Moe mai, moe mai a moengaroa. He aroha ki a koutou mō te whānau pani. Kai te mihi, kai te mihi, kai te mihi nunui ki a koutou. Kia kaha, kia toa, kia manawa nui.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 12 February 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Associate Minister of Tourism)
kōrero waenga:
Te mea tuatahi māku, kei te mihi atu ki a koe e te Kaiwhakahaere Tuarua o te Whare Pāremata mō tēnei tau hōu, kei te mihi atu ki a koe. Kei te mihi hoki ki ngā mema katoa o tēnei Whare Pāremata, ā, me tēnei Whare tupuna o tātou. I tēnei rā kei te mihi whānui atu ki a
 koutou katoa, tēna koutou, ā, tēna koutou katoa. Kei te tū tonu tēnei ki te tautoko I ngā kaupapa i pānuitia ai e te Peremia i nanahi nei, ngā kaupapa whakahaere mō te ao whānui, mō to motu o Aotearoa.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 12 February 2003
kōrero waenga: Tēnā koe e te Kaiwhakawā, koutou hoki ngā mema o te Whare nei.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 12 February 2003
kōrero waenga: E tū ahau ki te mihi ki a tātou, nō reira tēnā koutou.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 13 February 2003
kōrero waenga: Ko tōku nei tū tuatahi, he mihi aroha atu ki a rātou rā e piupiu ai te rau o te kawakawa, mai i te wā e whaka kapi mai tēnei pouwhare o te motu nei, tae noa mai ki te whakatūwhera anō i tēnei wā i roto, i runga i ngā rā e rua.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 20 February 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon PETER DUNNE (Chairperson of the Foreign Affairs, Defence and Trade Committee):

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 25 February 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon MARGARET WILSON (Associate Minister of Justice)

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 5 March 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon Dr MICHAEL CULLEN (Minister of Finance)

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 18 March 2003
kōrero waenga: Ngā mihi ki a koe; ka mihi ki a koutou ngā mema o te Whare nei.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 25 March 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon Dr MICHAEL CULLEN (Deputy Prime Minister)

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 26 March 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon PETER DUNNE (Chairperson of the Foreign Affairs, Defence and Trade Committee):

title:
Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 1 April 2003(continued on
 Wednesday, 2 April 2003)

Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 1 April 2003(continued on
 Wednesday, 2 April 2003)

Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 1 April 2003(continued on
 Wednesday, 2 April 2003)
kōrero waenga: Kia ora anō tātou i huihui mai nei i roto i tēnei Whare i tēnei pō. Ki ō tatou manuhiri, ki ngā rangatira o Ngāti Ruanui, nau mai, haere mai. Tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

title:
Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 1 April 2003(continued on
 Wednesday, 2 April 2003)

Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 1 April 2003(continued on
 Wednesday, 2 April 2003)
kōrero waenga: Ā, tēnā koutou e kui me te rōpū e haere maomao mai, mai raro i tā tāua nei maunga a Taranaki me te tihi o taua maunga. Uhia mai te tīpare rau kawakawa hei tohu nō te mate ki a rātou kua uhia mai i te korowai aroha i a rātou tīmata ai ō rātou nei hīkoi ki te mātātoru, te iti me te rahi, tēnā koutou. Tēnā koutou ō koutou nei maia ki te haramai ki te rongo atu i ngā kōrero kua whakahūātia kei roto i tēnei pouwhare. Kua rongo hoki koutou, kei te tautoko, tino tautoko mai te nuinga o mātou i te tikanga o tēnei pire. Nā, ka maumahara au i tētehi o ngā whakatauākītanga kōrero e whakaputa mai i ō tātou nei poropiti a Te Whiti ki te iwi i a rātou e noho i runga i te marae o Parihaka. Ka mētia e te poropiti ki a rātou ngā rōpū, “E te iwi ka riri mai te hau ki a mātou, ka piko. Ka mutu te riri e te hau ki a mātou, ka tū anō.” Nā, kua tae te wā. Ka tū mana anō koutou, mātou te katoa o ngā iwi o Taranaki i tēnei wā. Kia whakatūtuki pea i ngā auwētanga, i te haehae o te whatumanawa o rātou rā ngā tau heke, ā, kua ngaro ai te katoa. Me kī, me rātou rā e mauherere ai kei roto i ngā āna kei Te Waipounamu. A rātou rā kua mate ai, kua tanumia ai kei te whenua o Te Waipounamu. Nō reira, tēnā tātou.

title:
Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 1 April 2003(continued on
 Wednesday, 2 April 2003)
kōrero waenga:
In answer to the pātai from the honourable member from New Zealand First, I say there are seats for everyone to participate in the structure after the claim. It is there,
 he tūru mō ngā hapū, iwi katoa a Ngāti Ruanui Tangahoe me Takakohe. Kua kite ai te hiahiatanga kei roto o te wairua o rātou, kua waiho kotahi.

title:
Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 1 April 2003(continued on
 Wednesday, 2 April 2003)
kōrero waenga: Kia ora koutou katoa. He mihi nui he mihi aroha ki a Ngāti Ruanui, Tangahoe, me Pakakohi.

title:
Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 1 April 2003(continued on
 Wednesday, 2 April 2003)
kōrero waenga: Kāti, kia ora hui hui tātou. Taranaki maunga, Taranaki tangata, nau mai, hara mai, tēnā koutou. Tēnā koutou i ngā āhuatanga e pā ana ki tō kōtou hara mai rā i te nuku o te whenua i tēnei rā whakahirahira. Hei mātakitaki , hei tirotiro ki ngā āhuatanga e pā ana ki tā kōtou pire, nāna nei kua tae atu ki tōna mutunga. Nō reira, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou. Tēnā hoki koutou i ngā āhuatanga kei runga kei a koutou, ngā aituā maha, rātau kāre e tae-ā-tinana mai ana. Otirā, e tū poto noa iho tēnei ki te tautoko i ngā mahi e mahi ana i tō tātou Minita, a Mākareta te Wirihana, ā, me tō tātou Komiti Motuhake mō ngā Take Māori, me te heamana hoki, tā koutou tangata a Mahara Okoroa, ahakoa kei Pōneke e noho ana, kei a koutou tōna ngākau. Nō reira tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnāhoki tātau.

title:
Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 1 April 2003(continued on
 Wednesday, 2 April 2003)
kōrero waenga: I also acknowledge here in the House today representatives of Ngāti Ruanui. As I said: ā, Taranaki tangata, Taranaki maunga ahakoa he maunga titōhea, ka rere ngā manu ki reira unu ai, e kore e mimiti.

Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 1 April 2003(continued on
 Wednesday, 2 April 2003)

Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 8 April 2003
kōrero waenga: Tēnā koe e te Heamana. I mua i te haere tonu o tēnei tū, e mihi kau ana ki a koutou Ngāti Ruanui, nā te mea ko tēnei te wā tuatahi e tū ana au i roto i tēnei kaupapa. Nā reira, koia nei te take e mihi atu ki a koutou. He mihi hoki ki ērā o ngā whanaunga, karanga maha i hinga atu, ā, i tēnei wā ka hoki te mahara ki Maui Prime. Ko ia tētahi i whaka tīmata mai i tēnei kaupapa. Nā reira i te pō nei, kua pūawai. Nā reira, e mihi kau ana ki a rātou.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 9 April 2003
kōrero waenga: Kia ora tātou. Kei te mihi atu ki a koe te Kaiwhakahaere ō tēnei wāhanga mō te pire e pā ana ki a tātou te iwi Māori.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 9 April 2003
kōrero waenga: The member has a Māori name.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 9 April 2003
kōrero waenga: Te Aratuku Whakaata Irirangi Māori Act 2003.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 30 April 2003
kōrero waenga: Ā, tēnā koe e te Heamana. Ā, ngā mihi ki a tātou katoa. He mihi hoki ki te tuahine, mai i Tainui mō ōna whakaaro ki te whakahē i te pire nei. Kei te tatari mai i a au i ōna tungāne tokowhā i tautoko mai i tēnei pire. E aha ana te tino pūtake, i tautokongia rātou te āhuatanga o te pire nei nā te mea, kei te whakapae te nuinga o te iwi Māori. Ā, nā te mea kei te whakapae te nuinga o te iwi Māori, kei hea ngā mema Māori o te Kāwanatanga nei i runga tēnei kaupapa? E aha ana te take kei te noho wahangungu i a rātou? Tēnā pea, e tika ana te kōrero o tōku rangatira, a Winitana. He toa rātou i runga i te marae, he rēme i roto i te Whare nei.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 1 May 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon Dr MICHAEL CULLEN (Minister of Finance)

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 1 May 2003
kōrero waenga: Tēnā tātou katoa. Ngā mihi ki a koutou ki te maunga o Taranaki, mai Tongariro, te whare o te Heuheu, tēnā koutou. E mihi nui ki a koutou i tēnei rangi, he rangi nui tēnei. Nō reira, ki a tātou katoa, tēnā tātou katoa.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 1 May 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon TARIANA TURIA (Associate Minister of Māori Affairs (Social Development))
kōrero waenga: Ngāti Ruanui e noho nei ki te whakamana i te kaupapa o tēnei rā, tēnā koutou. Ka nui te tangi ki a koutou e whawhai tonu ana mō ēnei take, tēnā koutou.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 1 May 2003
kōrero waenga: Nō reira, e hoa ma ngā iwi Pākehā kei waenganui i a tātou i tēnei rā ko koutou ngā whanaunga, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, kia ora tātou katoa.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 1 May 2003
kōrero waenga: Tēnā koutou katoa. He mihi nui ki a koe, e te rangatira Pat Heremaia. He mihi aroha nui ki a Tangahoe, Pakakohe, me Ngāti Ruanui.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 1 May 2003
kōrero waenga: Nā, ka tū ki te mihi anō ki a koutou Aotea waka, Ngāti Ruanui me ngā hapu. Tēnā koutou e haramai nei kei roto i te Whare, ki te rongo atu i ngā kōrero maroke māi i taua tangata, e whaka hōhā mai ki a tātou katoa.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 1 May 2003
kōrero waenga: Kia ora! Otirā, tēnā koutou, Aotea waka, Taranaki tangata, te maunga tītōhea, ngā kārangaranga hapū kei waenganui i a koutou, tēnā koutou nau mai, hara mai. Nā koutou tonu tēnei rā. Ahakoa te iti, te rahi o ngā kōrero, kua hurihuri haere i roto i tēnei Whare, nā koutou tonu te kaupapa. E tautoko ana i ngā mihi o tēnei a tā koutou mokopuna. Nāna e kī, nāna i whakamārama i ngā taimahatanga, i whāwhāhia ai e koutou, mai i ngā rā ki muri, ā, tae noa ki tēnei wā. Otirā, o ngā kōrero maroke o ngā tangata kāre e matatau ana ki a koutou hōhonutanga, tō koutou mamae, me kī rā, he kōrero whakaparanga noa iho tērā. He whakaparanga noa iho nā te mea, ko koutou tonu ngā mea e mārama ana ki a koutou mamae, ā, taimahatanga katoa, e ngā maemaetanga i ūhiatia ai e te Karauna i runga i a koutou mātua, tūpuna i te wā i te pakanga ki roto i a Taranaki. Nō reira, me kī pēnei rā te kōrero, rirerire pai mārire.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 1 May 2003
kōrero waenga: Nā, ehara tēnei i te whakarōroa i te wā e noho ana koutou i roto i tēnei Whare. Kāhore! Kua tutuki ai i ngā kōrero i tā koutou tangata, te maunga i tītōhea kei tōku taha nei, a Mahara. Nāna i kōrero ā-papa ngākau ki a koutou, āna mōhiotanga, i ngā ritenga katoa e pā ana ki a koutou. Kua tū tēnei ki te whakatau atu, ki te whakaoti atu i tēnei wāhanga a tō koutou hīkoi i runga i tēnei huarahi tino roa rawa atu. Nō reira tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 1 May 2003
kōrero waenga: The people of Taranaki should confront the challenges as they come and have no fear, because they have a great legacy. I remember the words of Titokowaru; nāna i kī ai: “Ahakoa he maunga tītōhea, ka rere ngā manu ki reira unu ai, e kore, e kore, e mimiti.”

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 1 May 2003
kōrero waenga: Ki a koutou katoa, koi nei, kua oti katoa rā ngā āhuatanga e pā ana ki tēnei wāhanga o tō koutou pire. Hoki tonu atu ki ō koutou kāinga, ki ngā tini āhuatanga kei waenganui i ngā karanga hapū o Taranaki, ki te mahi i ngā mahi kai mua kai a koutou. Nō reira, me kī anō rā, ngā manaakitanga o Te Runga Rawa ki a koutou. Nō reira tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, kia ora tātou. E tau ana.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 1 May 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 1 May 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 1 May 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)
kōrero waenga:
I move,That the Māori Television Service (Te Aratuku Whakaata Irirangi Māori) Bill be now read a third time.
 E te rangatira whakahaere kōrero, tēnā koe. E aku hoa mema o te Kāwanatanga, me ngā mema o Tērā Tāha, tēnā tātou katoa. I a koutou, Winitana, e mihi ake anō i a koutou. He kaupapa whakahirahira rawa atu tēnei mō ngā iwi Māori katoa o Aotearoa, mō te reo Māori, mō ngā tikanga. Nā reira, he mea nui tonu tēnei ki te whakatakoto i Te Pire Aratuku Whakaata Irirangi Māori kī tēnei Whare mō te pānuitanga tuatoru. Tēnā tātou katoa.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 6 May 2003
kōrero waenga:
Tēnei ka tū au ki te kōrero mō tēnei pire e kīa nei ko te Aratuku Whakaata Irirangi Māori. Ahakoa te poto o tēnei kōrero, māku te wā e whakamāramatia te take ka tautoko ana mātou i tēnei pire.
 I rise to speak to the third reading of the Māori Television Service Bill. Although my contribution will be short, it is really to outline some of the reasons that members on this side of the House, who are part of the Government, support the bill.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 6 May 2003
kōrero waenga:
Nō reira, ka huri au ki te take i tukuna mai tēnei pire kei waenga nui i a tātou. Mēnā ka huri ki ngā kōrero whakataki i te tīmatanga o te pire nei, me titiro tātou ki ngā e rua o ngā wāhanga. Ko te wāhanga tuatahi, e kīa nei kia kaha ake te ūtanga o te Karauna ki te tiaki i te reo Māori. Ka whakaae te Karauna ki ēnei whakatau.
 If we look to two paragraphs in the preamble to this bill, we will have an appreciation of the context within which the bill sets out to establish the Māori Television Service. In the clause that I cited, I referred to the findings of the tribunal, which found that the Crown is obliged by the treaty to take active steps to protect the Māori language. The Crown accepted those findings.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 6 May 2003
kōrero waenga:
Nō reira, me huri atu ki te wāhanga tuarua. Ka whakaae te Karauna, he here mutunga kore tā ngā mātāpono o te Tiriti o Waitangi ki te pīkau, kia pūmau tonu te manaaki i te reo Māori mā te whakamahia o ngā mahi pāpāho reo irirangi, whakaata irirangi anō hoki.
 In paragraph (2) of the preamble to the bill, we read that “the Crown accepted that the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi impose a continuing obligation to take such steps as are reasonable to assist in the preservation of te reo Māori by the use of both radio and television broadcasting:”.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 6 May 2003
kōrero waenga:
Ki ahau nei, ahakoa te poto o tōku nei kōrero mō te pire nei, ko tāku nei, ko te wawata mō ngā whakatipuranga hei whakarongo ki tō tātau nei reo, ahakoa torutoru noa iho i te tīmatanga, a te wā ka whakawhānui atu ki tētehi atu, ki te motu whānui kia mōhiotia e rātau te ātaahua o tō tātau nei reo engari, kia mōhio rātau kei te ora tonu, kei te ora tonu mō ake tonu atu. Tēnā koutou. Although mine is just a short contribution, and a bilingual one, it is important that this bill go ahead. At the outset only a small number of people will be exposed to programmes in te reo Māori via this bill, but it is our aspiration that that exposure extend out in time. It can only be good to hear that ours is a living, flourishing language that will live on in all our communities for ever.
 Nō reira, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, kia ora mai tātau katoa.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 6 May 2003
kōrero waenga: Madam Chair, I beg your indulgence of my addressing the old people of our Māori community, to let them know the effects of this bill. Nā reira koutou ngā kaumātua, ngā kuikuia e noho tonu ki te wā kāinga, anei te kaupapa o tēnei Kāwanatanga i whakatakoto mai i mua i a tātau i roto i tēnei Whare. Kite koe i ngā inu i inuhia i a koutou ki te whakamahana tā koutou tinana? E hiahia ana tēnei Kāwanatanga kia whakanui te utunga mō ērā o ngā inu. Nā reira, koutou mā, aroha mai ki tēnei tā koutou tamaiti, mokopuna e kōrerohia i tēnei wā nā te mea, kei hea ngā mema Māori, ngā mema nā koutou i whakatohungia he kaīkōrero mā koutou? Ka nui taku aroha i a koutou. Moumou tā koutou tāima ki te tautoko i a rātou. Nā reira, tēnā pea mā te wā ka kite mai i a koutou, ko wai ngā Rōpū e tika ana hei kaikōrero mā koutou. Whakaarongia koutou ki a koutou rangatahi ki te āhuatanga o tēnei pire e hiahia ana te Kāwana kia whakamana, kia whakatau hoki. Mehemea e horekau i wātea ngā inu ki ngā rangatahi i āianei nā, kei te haere tonu i a rātou ki te mau, ki te kai hoki i ngā tarutaru o tēnei ao. Nā reira e tātou mā, koinā noa ngā kōrero mō tēnei wā, engari ka hoki mai i a au i roto i wā tātou reo e rua.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 6 May 2003
kōrero waenga: Ahakoa, taihoa, pai atu tēnā tangata ki te kōrero mai i tēnā tū āhua. Engari nā rātau, i tata ake nei, i whakatau tētahi pire ki te whakanui, ki te whakamōhio tātou te iwi whanui te reo Māori. Engari i tenei wā, whakarongo mai i a ia, he kohete mai ki a au, i runga ake i taku tūnga, ki te whakakoretake i wā tātau reo rangatira. Tika atu te āhua i a rātau i tētahi wā, nā rātau i whakamana tā tātau nā reo, engari i tēnei wā, i roto i te kōrero o tēnei kaupapa, nā rātau i whakakoretake tēnei kōrero.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 8 May 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon LIANNE DALZIEL (Associate Minister of Justice)

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 13 May 2003
kōrero waenga:
Te mea tuatahi māku me mihi atu ki ngā manuhiri, Ngāti Tama tēnā koutou i tae mai nei i tēnei pō ki te whakarongo i ngā kōrero, e whakawhitiwhiti ana i roto i tēnei Whare. Nō reira nau mai, haere mai, haere mai.
 I welcome the people of Ngāti Tama who have come to listen to this bill being discussed in the House tonight. We hope that they will go away with positive thoughts about what is being discussed this evening.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 13 May 2003
kōrero waenga: Tēnei ka tū au ki te tautoko ngā mihi ki ngā mōrehu o Ngāti Tama, tēnā koutou. Ka mihi atu rā ki tō koutou nei maunga a Taranaki, ki ngā kāwai kōrero e pā ana ki ō koutou nei mātua, tūpuna e pā ana ki te whenua. Ko ngā hononga kei waenganui i a mātou nei nō Waikato e pā ana ki ngā whenua i raupatutia, i riro whenua atu, me hoki whenua mai. Nō reira tēnei te mihi atu ki a koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 13 May 2003
kōrero waenga:
Ka hoki ōku mahara ki ngā whakaaro o te taraipiunara i roto i tā rātau nei ripoata e pā ana ki tēnei take. E ai ki ō rātou nei whakaaro, ko te tūturutanga o tēnei take, e pā ana ki ngā whakaaetanga kei waenganui i te Karauna me ngā iwi katoa o Taranaki, me noho tūturu te Karauna i raro i ō rātou nei whakaaro.
 I want to return some of my contribution to the tenor of the report that was released by the Waitangi Tribunal regarding the Taranaki claims as a whole. It is really about the durability of the agreement between the Crown and all Taranaki iwi when they seek the return of their lands and all the agreements therein.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 13 May 2003
kōrero waenga: Nō reira, ko ōku nei kōrero whakamutunga ki ngā mōrehu o Ngāti Tama, ka mihi atu rā ki a koutou i tēnei wā ahakoa ko tēnei te wā tuatahi mo ngā mema katoa o tēnei Whare hei kite i ngā āhuatanga e pā ana ki ō koutou nei take. Ka mihi atu rā ki a koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 13 May 2003
kōrero waenga:
Ā, te mea tuatahi māku, kei te mihi atu ki te whānau o Ngāti Tama e whakaruruhau nei i raro o te maunga tapu o Taranaki, me ngā uri katoa, kei te mihi atu ki a koutou. Kei te maumahara ki ngā tūpuna, ki ngā mātua kua wehe atu ki te pō. Nā rātau nei tēnei kaupapa mai rā anō i tautoko, i poipoi tae noa ki tēnei rā. Nō reira, kia maumahara atu ki a rātau, kore rātau e warewaretia i roto i ā rātau moemoeā, ā, wawata.
 I am acknowledging the whānau of Ngāti Tama, and also the aspirations of those people who have passed on, in terms of their vision and their hopes that justice would come to their people.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 13 May 2003
kōrero waenga: Nō reira, kei te huri ana ki te mihi ki a koutou ngā whanaunga o Ngāti Tama, te maunga o Taranaki. Tērā, ka whakarongo mai i ngā kōrero tērā o tātou whanaunga i tērā taha o Hikurangi, kei te tautoko atu. Huri ana i tō tātou Whare, mā te Runga Rawa tātou katoa e manaaki. Tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, ā, kia ora mai anō tātou katoa. Kia ora tātou.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 13 May 2003
kōrero waenga: Ki a koutou katoa, he mihi nui ki a Ngāti Tama, e kui mā, e koro mā me ngā rangatahi katoa, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 14 May 2003
kōrero waenga:
Tēnei kei te mihi atu ki a koe te
 Kaiwhakahaere o te Whare. Kei te mihi hoki ki
 ngāmātua, ki
 ngāwhāea o
 ngā tamariki e
 whakarongo mai ana ki
 ēneiwhakawhitiwhitikōreroi roto
 i te Whare
 Pāremataitēneipō.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 20 May 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)
kōrero waenga: Mr Speaker, mihi kau ana ki a koe i roto i te Tūru rā, i a rātau e rongo ake anō ki te kōrero nei ki ngā mema o te Whare Miere nei, tēnā koe.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 21 May 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon JOHN TAMIHERE (Minister of Youth Affairs)
kōrero waenga:
In that respect, I want to pause and pay a special mihi to one of our VIP drivers who passed away last night—RichardMangu.
 E te rangatira ki a mātau Richard, e aroha ana ki a koe. Kāre e warewaretia e mātau, me ngā mahi maha ki te awhi i a mātau. Kāre e warewaretia. Nō reira, Richard, moe mai, moe mai i te moenga roa. E te whānau pani, he aroha ki a koutou mai i ngā mema o te Pāremata. E Richard, he aroha. He aroha ki a koutou.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 21 May 2003
kōrero waenga: Ka tū mai ahau ki te tautoko mai i te mihi poroporoaki ki tētehi o ngā rangatira e tiaki mai i ngā Minita katoa mai rā anō. Ko te tangata rā hoki, hoki atu ki tana kāinga ūkaipō. Ka tū mai ahau ki te mihi mai ki tēnā e tautoko mai i te kōrero o tōku nei hoa a Tamihere. Kei a koe hei whakapākehatia.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 21 May 2003
kōrero waenga: Otirā, te wāhi tuatahi anō tautoko ake ngā mihi ki tō tātou rangatira kua huri ai ki tua o te ārai. Koi rā a Rihari Mangu. Kua hinga atu nei, ā, hoki atu nā ki tōna wā kāinga, tēnei te mihi ake, poroporoaki nei ki a ia.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 12 June 2003
kōrero waenga: So what Tame Te Rangi did was OK?

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 12 June 2003
kōrero waenga: Ā, e te iwi kua whakarongo mai i ngā rarurarutanga o roto i tēnei Whare Pāremata, mai rā anō, kua mōhio koutou i ngā tāngata e whakararuraru i a mātau te iwi Māori. Engari e te iwi, ka tū tonu mātau nei ki te hāpai tika i te kaupapa o tātau katoa. Ngā kaupapa e whakatiaki mai i te reo me ngā mahi o te pouaka tango whakaahua, me ērā atu o ngā taonga o ō koro, a kui mā.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 12 June 2003
kōrero waenga: Ā tēnā koe e te Kaiwhakawā, engari i mua i te haere tonu i waku kōrero i te ahiahi nei, he mihi tēnei ki a koutou. Ahau nei, horekau i whakahē wō kōrero e te mema mai i Te Tai Tonga. Engari, māku e mea atu ki a koe, te nuinga o ngā taumahatanga i taka mai kei runga i tō tātou whanaunga a Parekura, ehara i taka ana kei runga ki a ia anahe, engari aua taumahatanga i taka mai kei runga i a tātou ngā mema Māori katoa. Nā reira māku e meatia ki a koutou, kia maumahara ki ngā kōrero o ō tātou matoa, o ō tātou tūpuna, kia tika, kia pono. Mehemea i whakarere kē i a mātau ēnā kupu kōrero, nā, ka puta mai nga hua, ote ra nei mo tonu atu.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 25 June 2003
kōrero waenga:
Tēnā koe, Mr Speaker, ā,
 tēnā koutou
 i tau mai
 neii te
 pōnei.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 25 June 2003
kōrero waenga:
Tēnā koe,
 tēnātātau katoa. Ā, ka
 tū au ki te mihi ki
 ngā hoa
 rangapū katoa
 i roto
 itēnei Whare
 Pāremata e
 pāana ki
 tēnei take, te mahi
 pūremu, te mahi
 kairau. Ā, tuatahi ka
 tū au ki te hoki
 ōku mahara ki
 ngā kupu
 kōrero o
 ngāmātua,
 tūpuna ko te
 wahine te whare tangata. Ko te
 wahine te whare
 kōrero, ko te
 wahine te whare
 wānanga.
 Koinātētehi o
 ngā tohu rangatira ki a
 mātaungāwahine, hei tiaki
 i ō
 tātaunei tamariki, kia kore, kia kore, kia kore e
 warewarengātohutohu a koro, a
 kuimānō te
 mea, kei a
 rātaungāwhakatupuranga, kei a
 rātaungākākano a
 tōnawā ka
 puāwai.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 25 June 2003
kōrero waenga:
Tēnā koe, Mr Speaker,
 tēnā no
 tātou.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Thursday, 26 June 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: The ASSISTANT SPEAKER (H V Ross Robertson)

Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 23 July 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon JOHN TAMIHERE (Associate Minister of Māori Affairs)
kōrero waenga: Ā, ki a koe e te rangatira. E te whanaunga, rangatira, kei te Minita, kei te mihi nunui ki a koe mō tō mahi kei te awhi i a mātau. He iwi kotahi tātou mō ngā motu. No reira, tēnā rā koe. Kai wareware i a mātou mō ngā mema ki tēnei taha, kei te mahi kaha mō ngā kaimahi mō te Tari o Te Puni Kōkiri. No reira, Leith, mō tō rōpu, mō te kaimahi, kai te mihi, kai te mihi, kai te mihi nunui ki a koutou.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 30 July 2003
kōrero waenga: He aha ngaa kaupapa i te Kawanatanga. He tautoko ngaa mahi taapoi Maaori?

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 30 July 2003
kōrero waenga: He aha ētehi o ngā taonga tūturu Māori e pai ana ki ngā manuwhiri tuārangi i tō rātou taunga mai ki Aotearoa?

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 30 July 2003
kōrero waenga: Kei hea tētahi wāhi marumaru mō te mana whakairo hinengaro me te mana ahurea Māori, kei whakahekea ki te tūranga o te tiki kirihōu?

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 30 July 2003
kōrero waenga:
Koia tēnā tētahi a ngā tirohanga a te rīpoata a te Kāwanatanga mō ngā āhuatanga e pā ana ki ngā tāpoi Māori e pā ana ki te iwi Māori. Nā, ko tēnā ko tētahi o ngā taonga e kōrero nei i roto o te rīpoata kei te whai i te Kāwanatanga.
 There is a report from Te Puni Kōkiri in terms of branding Māori and using a standard in terms of the presentation and production of the Māori tourism product right throughout Aotearoa.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 30 July 2003
kōrero waenga: “E mahara iho ana, he waka ka urutomo; he ika rere ki Hikurangi rā ia.” Ka maumahara hoki ki aku tīpuna, arā, a Hone rāua ko Wahine, a Elsdon rāua ko Zeta; haere e ngā mate, haere atu koutou i te huanui, i te ara kua papa tauria e te tapuwae kauika tangata. Takoto mai koutou i te urunga e kore nekehia, i te moenga e kore hikitia. Haere, haere, haere, whakaoti atu koutou.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 30 July 2003
kōrero waenga: Ki taku iwi a Ngāti Porou, aku mātua a Janet rāua ko Hone, taku tuahine a Erin, taku teina a Tūrei, ngā whanaunga, ngā hoa piripono, ngā mihi nui mō tā koutou tautoko mai i tēnei tamaiti, mokopuna i runga i tēnei huarahi hōu i tēnei rā me ngā rā kei mua. Ki aku hoa mahi hoki o Te Rōpū Reipa, te Pirimia Helen Clark, tēnā koe. He mihi atu tēnei kia koutou katoa. I te ika rere, mai i te tihi o Hikurangi maunga horapa ana ki te ao.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 30 July 2003
kōrero waenga: Tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 26 August 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon JOHN TAMIHERE (Minister of Youth Affairs)
kōrero waenga: E te Kaihautū, e te whakaruruhau ki a mātau, Ross, tēnā rā koe. E tū ake au ki te mihi nunui ki a koe e te rangatira Russell, nō reira, i tua o te ārai kua whetūrangitia, tēnei i mihi atu mō te tamaiti kōrua. Ā, moe mai, moe mai i te moenga roa, te uri a Russell. Nō reira, aroha ki a koutou. Mō te whānau pani, kia kaha, kia toa, kia manawa nui.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Tuesday, 14 October 2003
ingoa kaikōrero: Hon JOHN TAMIHERE (Minister of Youth Affairs)
kōrero waenga:
E te
 kaihautū me te
 whakaruruhau,
 tēnārā koe.
 Ngā mihi
 nunui ki te
 whānui o te motu, kei te mihi
 nunui ki a koutou. Taku
 īnoi ki a koutou—e aroha ki a koe, Georgina, aroha ki a koe, aroha ki a koe.
 Mōhio ki a
 mātou, aroha ki a koutou. Nō reira, ki a koutou
 mā, taku
 īnoi e
 ngā iwi
 whānui kia
 mau te kaupapa
 nunui, te kaupapa
 tūturumōrātoungātīpuna. Te mana motuhake
 mōmātou.
 Katia te
 pitomō te
 Kāwanatanga. Engari, e
 tūake au ki te tautoko te mana whenua, te mana
 mōngā iwi, kotahi
 tātoumō te whenua o Aotearoa.
 Kārerātoungātīpuna e
 warewaretia e
 mātau.
 Takototonu,
 takototonu, ā,
 takototonu.

title: Parliamentary Debates (Hansard) for Wednesday, 15 October 2003
kōrero waenga: There are lots more to come.
